column4: hey guys. i have a few questions about setting up HA on ubuntu 12.04 lts. anyone here have any experience with that?
as in High Availability?  That and Ubuntu don't exactly mix.
speak to Canonical about getting support for that.  They will provide all the help you need
Well I was going to use heartbeat and pacemaker
when it comes to mission-critical, don't skimp on support =]
The problem with that is I have to have this done today and I don't think that gives me a large enough window of time to get support.
ah, that's a bit tight.  If you're not tied to any particular distro, you could always ask the #centos folks how you'd do it if you used their distro
the reason I say this is because although Ubuntu is awesome, it isn't popular with large-scale clustering, HA or big private virt farms yet

So basically I need to setup 2 hp servers with 24tb disk arrays that need to be clustered for HA, authenticated via AD, and setup with an NFS, AFP (netatalk), and Samba Share, and they all have to be highly available, and synced through both servers, and all authenticated with AD
got a budget?  If you need faster support you could ring up Red Hat and get a quote if Canonical support isn't quick enough
Yes, It's probably along the lines of $500 USD
if you need a free/community solution, you're probably better off with CentOS, they have people who deal with this sort of thing
